title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0232

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine, and we have a very fun lesson for you today.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们有一节非常有趣的课。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We're going to talk about toys.
segments.cn: 我们要谈论玩具。

segments.en: So we're going to actually take a look at a lot of different types of toys, and we're going to be listening to a couple of commercials.
segments.cn: 所以我们将实际看看许多不同类型的玩具，并听几个广告。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So we've got two children who are watching TV, and they're listening to a number of different commercials.
segments.cn: 我们有两个孩子在看电视，他们在听许多不同的广告。

segments.en: So we're going to learn about some of these very popular products in a moment.
segments.cn: 所以我们马上就要了解一些非常受欢迎的产品。

segments.en: Let's first listen to our dialogue.
segments.cn: 让我们先听听我们的对话。

segments.en: SpongeBob SquarePants will be right back after these brave messages.
segments.cn: 海绵宝宝将在这些勇敢的广告后回来。

segments.en: What's that on the horizon?
segments.cn: 地平线上是什么？

segments.en: A pirate ship.
segments.cn: 一艘海盗船。

segments.en: Raid villages and find buried treasure with these new pirates Lego set.
segments.cn: 用这个新的海盗乐高套装袭击村庄并寻找埋藏的宝藏。

segments.en: Build a ship and decide who rules the sea.
segments.cn: 建造一艘船，决定谁统治海洋。

segments.en: Arr!
segments.cn: 啊！

segments.en: Cool!
segments.cn: 酷！

segments.en: The new Play-Doh Sparkling Brights Precious Gem Press.
segments.cn: 新的Play-Doh闪亮宝石压模。

segments.en: Make large colorful gems for you and your friends with five special malts.
segments.cn: 用五种特殊模具为你和你的朋友制作大型彩色宝石。

segments.en: Comes with the new Sparkling Brights Play-Doh Compound in four new colors.
segments.cn: 配有四种新颜色的闪亮Play-Doh。

segments.en: Treasure chest sold separately.
segments.cn: 宝箱单独出售。

segments.en: Wow, Mommy!
segments.cn: 哇，妈妈！

segments.en: Can I get that for my birthday?
segments.cn: 我可以在生日时要这个吗？

segments.en: Wolverine, Jean Grey, Rogue, and Professor X.
segments.cn: 金刚狼、琴·格蕾、罗格和X教授。

segments.en: Collect all four of these special edition collectible X-Men action figures and decide the future of the mutants in our world.
segments.cn: 收集这四个特别版的X-Men动作人偶，决定我们世界中变种人的未来。

segments.en: No way!
segments.cn: 不可能！

segments.en: I want Professor X!
segments.cn: 我想要X教授！

segments.en: The new Collectors Edition Nursery Rhymes Porcelain Dolls.
segments.cn: 新的收藏版童谣瓷娃娃。

segments.en: Little Bo Peep comes with her own shape and staff.
segments.cn: 小波皮佩带着她自己的形状和权杖。

segments.en: Her clothes are made with the finest fabrics and real Italian lace.
segments.cn: 她的衣服用最好的面料和真正的意大利蕾丝制成。

segments.en: And her face has been hand painted by our finest artists.
segments.cn: 她的脸是由我们最优秀的艺术家手工绘制的。

segments.en: Only $199.
segments.cn: 只需199美元。

segments.en: Ooh, she's pretty!
segments.cn: 哦，她真漂亮！

segments.en: I've never had a porcelain doll before.
segments.cn: 我从来没有过瓷娃娃。

segments.en: I doubt Mom and Dad will get you that for your birthday.
segments.cn: 我怀疑爸爸妈妈会在你生日时给你买这个。

segments.en: She costs a pretty penny.
segments.cn: 她可不便宜。

segments.en: Plus, you'd most likely break her.
segments.cn: 而且，你很可能会把她弄坏。

segments.en: What is better than a board?
segments.cn: 什么比一个棋盘更好？

segments.en: What is better than one board game?
segments.cn: 什么比一个棋盘游戏更好？

segments.en: Three board games in one!
segments.cn: 三个棋盘游戏合为一体！

segments.en: Enjoy playing chess and checkers on this side of the board.
segments.cn: 在棋盘的一侧享受下棋和跳棋的乐趣。

segments.en: But if you're looking for some more fun, flip it and play the classic game of Sorry.
segments.cn: 但如果你想要更多乐趣，翻转它，玩经典的“对不起”游戏。

segments.en: That's ingenious!
segments.cn: 这真是太聪明了！

segments.en: Why hasn't anyone thought of that before?
segments.cn: 为什么之前没有人想到这个？

segments.en: Now you can take SpongeBob SquarePants wherever you go with the new SpongeBob SquarePants glow in the dark yo-yo.
segments.cn: 现在你可以带着新的海绵宝宝夜光悠悠球到任何地方。

segments.en: And now, back to our show.
segments.cn: 现在，回到我们的节目。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So a lot of great toys.
segments.cn: 所以有很多很棒的玩具。

segments.en: And actually, it's very popular that while maybe you're watching cartoons, you get a lot of these commercials that are selling you all types of toys.
segments.cn: 实际上，通常在你看卡通时，会看到许多销售各种玩具的广告。

segments.en: Absolutely, because normally children watch cartoons and children like toys, so it makes sense.
segments.cn: 绝对是，因为通常孩子们看卡通，孩子们喜欢玩具，所以这很有道理。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So why don't we take a look at six keywords that we have for you on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 那么我们来看看我们为你准备的六个关键词吧。

segments.en: Okay, Marco, so what's the first word we're looking at here today?
segments.cn: 好的，Marco，今天我们要看的第一个词是什么？

segments.en: All right, we have actually a brand, a very famous type of toy.
segments.cn: 好的，我们实际上有一个品牌，一种非常著名的玩具。

segments.en: They're called Legos.
segments.cn: 它们叫乐高。

segments.en: Legos.
segments.cn: 乐高。

segments.en: So Lego Legos.
segments.cn: 所以乐高乐高。

segments.en: Legos.
segments.cn: 乐高。

segments.en: So Legos are basically little pieces that you put together to build things.
segments.cn: 所以乐高基本上是你拼装在一起以建造东西的小块。

segments.en: Yeah, they're like little blocks.
segments.cn: 是的，它们就像小积木。

segments.en: Okay, so when you see them, they don't look like anything.
segments.cn: 好的，所以当你看到它们时，它们看起来像什么都不是。

segments.en: But as a child, you get to create anything you want.
segments.cn: 但作为孩子，你可以创造任何你想要的东西。

segments.en: So Legos have become very famous.
segments.cn: 所以乐高变得非常有名。

segments.en: They have like special types that you can recreate, maybe a spaceship from Star Wars, a pirate ship, a lot of different types now.
segments.cn: 它们有特殊类型，你可以重建，比如星球大战的宇宙飞船、海盗船，现在有很多不同类型。

segments.en: Okay, so the one in today's commercial is Pirate Legos.
segments.cn: 好的，今天广告中的就是海盗乐高。

segments.en: So they're building a pirate ship.
segments.cn: 所以他们在建造一艘海盗船。

segments.en: Exactly, Legos.
segments.cn: 没错，乐高。

segments.en: All right, and the next toy that we have is also a proper noun.
segments.cn: 好的，下一个玩具也是一个专有名词。

segments.en: It's a brand, and it's called Play-Doh.
segments.cn: 它是一个品牌，叫Play-Doh。

segments.en: Play-Doh.
segments.cn: Play-Doh。

segments.en: Okay, so play like playing with something, playing basketball.
segments.cn: 好的，所以play像玩什么，打篮球。

segments.en: But Play-Doh is... It's like Clay, right?
segments.cn: 但Play-Doh是……它像粘土，对吗？

segments.en: It's like Clay, but it's made out of flour, I think, and you can shape it into anything you want.
segments.cn: 它像粘土，但我想它是用面粉做的，你可以把它塑造成任何你想要的东西。

segments.en: So when I was little, I used to make Play-Doh animals.
segments.cn: 所以当我小时候，我常常做Play-Doh动物。

segments.en: You know, you could make a ball, and you make another ball, and then all of a sudden you have a cow.
segments.cn: 你知道，你可以做一个球，再做一个球，然后突然你就有了一头牛。

segments.en: Right, so it's a very soft texture type of a material that you can mold.
segments.cn: 对，所以这是一种非常柔软的材料，你可以塑形。

segments.en: You can give it different shapes, and that's what we call Play-Doh.
segments.cn: 你可以给它不同的形状，这就是我们所说的Play-Doh。

segments.en: Obviously, as you say, it's safe for children.
segments.cn: 显然，正如你所说，它对孩子是安全的。

segments.en: I think it's made out of some flour.
segments.cn: 我想它是用一些面粉做的。

segments.en: And I think a lot of children sometimes eat this, so it's pretty safe for kids.
segments.cn: 我想很多孩子有时会吃这个，所以对孩子来说相当安全。

segments.en: Right, so yeah, that's Play-Doh.
segments.cn: 对，所以是的，这就是Play-Doh。

segments.en: It's a proper noun, and I guess everyone just calls it Play-Doh, so this is the toy that we're talking about.
segments.cn: 这是一个专有名词，我想每个人都称它为Play-Doh，所以这是我们所谈论的玩具。

segments.en: Now moving on, we are talking about the X-Men.
segments.cn: 现在继续，我们在谈论X-Men。

segments.en: Wolverine, Jean Grey, Rogue, Professor X, and all of these come in little statues that we call action figures.
segments.cn: 金刚狼、琴·格蕾、罗格、X教授，所有这些都有小雕像，我们称之为动作人偶。

segments.en: All right, so what you're talking about here are obviously the X-Men, Marco.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你在这里谈论的显然是X-Men，Marco。

segments.en: And X-Men, there are many different kinds of X-Men.
segments.cn: X-Men有很多不同种类。

segments.en: You have, like you said, Wolverine, who's maybe one of the most famous, and Rogue.
segments.cn: 你有，正如你所说，金刚狼，可能是最著名的，还有罗格。

segments.en: But when you collect these little statues, these little dolls, they're called action figures.
segments.cn: 但当你收集这些小雕像，这些小玩偶时，它们被称为动作人偶。

segments.en: So a figure is like a kind of doll.
segments.cn: 所以人偶就像一种玩偶。

segments.en: Right, so the X-Men is just an example.
segments.cn: 对，所以X-Men只是一个例子。

segments.en: You have action figures of all sorts of cartoons or movies.
segments.cn: 你有各种卡通或电影的动作人偶。

segments.en: Star Wars action figures are very popular.
segments.cn: 星球大战的动作人偶非常受欢迎。

segments.en: Right, or G.I.
segments.cn: 对，或者G.I.

segments.en: Joe action figures are very popular as well.
segments.cn: Joe的动作人偶也非常受欢迎。

segments.en: That's right, so they're little toy statues that children play with.
segments.cn: 没错，所以它们是孩子们玩的玩具雕像。

segments.en: All right, moving on, now we have an adjective, a way to describe the X-Men.
segments.cn: 好的，继续，现在我们有一个形容词，描述X-Men的方式。

segments.en: That's right, so the X-Men, as you know, are not normal people.
segments.cn: 没错，正如你所知道的，X-Men不是普通人。

segments.en: They have special powers.
segments.cn: 他们有特殊的能力。

segments.en: Some X-Men can fly.
segments.cn: 一些X-Men可以飞。

segments.en: Wolverine has animal abilities.
segments.cn: 金刚狼有动物能力。

segments.en: He can use his long claws.
segments.cn: 他可以使用他那长长的爪子。

segments.en: So these are mutants.
segments.cn: 所以这些是变种人。

segments.en: That means that they were humans, but something changed in them, and it makes them have these special powers.
segments.cn: 这意味着他们曾经是人类，但他们身上发生了变化，使他们拥有这些特殊的能力。

segments.en: So a mutant is maybe a person that has special powers, like as you say Wolverine and all these types of X-Men.
segments.cn: 所以变种人可能是拥有特殊能力的人，就像你说的金刚狼和所有这些类型的X战警。

segments.en: But I guess taking maybe a look at the verb mutate, that means to change.
segments.cn: 但我想看看动词“变异”，这意味着改变。

segments.en: To change, right.
segments.cn: 改变，对。

segments.en: Okay, so to mutate is to change.
segments.cn: 好的，所以变异就是改变。

segments.en: So we could say, I found a frog that had three legs.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以说，我发现了一只有三条腿的青蛙。

segments.en: So it clearly mutated, because normally frogs have like four legs.
segments.cn: 所以它显然变异了，因为通常青蛙有四条腿。

segments.en: Exactly, you see that sometimes with chickens that maybe have two heads or something like this.
segments.cn: 正是如此，你有时会看到鸡有两个头或类似的情况。

segments.en: These are mutants.
segments.cn: 这些是变种人。

segments.en: They have mutated.
segments.cn: 他们已经变异了。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And now moving on to our dolls.
segments.cn: 现在继续我们的洋娃娃。

segments.en: They were talking about these beautiful porcelain dolls.
segments.cn: 他们在谈论这些美丽的瓷娃娃。

segments.en: Okay, so let's talk about porcelain, because I think everyone knows what a doll is, but porcelain is a special kind of doll, right?
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们来谈谈瓷器，因为我想每个人都知道什么是娃娃，但瓷器是一种特殊的娃娃，对吧？

segments.en: Right, it's a material.
segments.cn: 对，它是一种材料。

segments.en: And usually you can find this material very commonly in your plates.
segments.cn: 通常你可以在你的盘子中很常见地找到这种材料。

segments.en: All right, so it's not clear, it's not glass.
segments.cn: 好的，所以它不是透明的，不是玻璃。

segments.en: It's colored, it's normally whitish.
segments.cn: 它是有颜色的，通常是白色的。

segments.en: And very, very fine, very pretty.
segments.cn: 非常非常细腻，非常漂亮。

segments.en: So you call it porcelain, I guess it's a type of ceramic, right?
segments.cn: 所以你称它为瓷器，我想这是一种陶瓷，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, so yeah, you have porcelain dolls.
segments.cn: 好的，所以是的，你有瓷娃娃。

segments.en: Many people also have very fine China that you call it, like dinner plates.
segments.cn: 很多人也有你所说的精美中国瓷器，比如餐盘。

segments.en: Or teacups.
segments.cn: 或茶杯。

segments.en: Or teacups, and those are usually made of porcelain.
segments.cn: 或茶杯，这些通常是用瓷器制成的。

segments.en: All right, and finally they were talking about a game that has three games in one, and one of the kids said, wow, that's ingenious.
segments.cn: 好的，最后他们在谈论一个有三个游戏的游戏，其中一个孩子说，哇，这真是巧妙。

segments.en: Ingenious.
segments.cn: 巧妙。

segments.en: This is a great word, makes you sound really fluent.
segments.cn: 这是一个很好的词，让你听起来很流利。

segments.en: So ingenious basically means clever.
segments.cn: 所以巧妙基本上意味着聪明。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: It's a really good idea.
segments.cn: 这是一个很好的主意。

segments.en: It's very clever, good idea, yeah.
segments.cn: 这非常聪明，好的主意，是的。

segments.en: So if something is ingenious, it's just wow, it's very creative.
segments.cn: 所以如果某事是巧妙的，那就是哇，非常有创意。

segments.en: For example, I have a pair of gloves, but on the fingers sometimes I can pull a cover over them and they turn into mittens, right?
segments.cn: 例如，我有一双手套，但有时我可以把一个罩子拉在手指上，它们就变成了连指手套，对吧？

segments.en: I think it's ingenious.
segments.cn: 我觉得这很巧妙。

segments.en: You have gloves and mittens.
segments.cn: 你有手套和连指手套。

segments.en: I have gloves and mittens all the time.
segments.cn: 我一直都有手套和连指手套。

segments.en: All right, so a lot of interesting words there, a lot of specific toys, and particularly brands that you may or may not know.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这里有很多有趣的词，很多特定的玩具，特别是你可能知道或不知道的品牌。

segments.en: But why don't we go back and listen to the dialogue again, and we'll be back with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 但我们为什么不回去再听一遍对话，然后我们将回到流利构建者。

segments.en: SpongeBob SquarePants will be right back after these brief messages.
segments.cn: 海绵宝宝将在这些简短的广告后回来。

segments.en: What's that on the horizon?
segments.cn: 地平线上是什么？

segments.en: A pirate ship!
segments.cn: 一艘海盗船！

segments.en: Raid villages and find buried treasure with these new Pirates Lego set.
segments.cn: 用这些新的海盗乐高套装袭击村庄并寻找埋藏的宝藏。

segments.en: Build a ship and decide who rules the sea.
segments.cn: 建造一艘船，决定谁统治海洋。

segments.en: Cool!
segments.cn: 酷！

segments.en: The new Play-Doh Sparkling Brights Precious Gem Press.
segments.cn: 新的Play-Doh闪亮宝石压模。

segments.en: Make large colorful gems for you and your friends with five special molds.
segments.cn: 用五个特殊模具为你和你的朋友制作大型彩色宝石。

segments.en: Comes with the new Sparkling Brights Play-Doh Compound in four new colors.
segments.cn: 附带四种新颜色的闪亮Play-Doh材料。

segments.en: Treasure chest sold separately.
segments.cn: 宝箱单独出售。

segments.en: Wow, Mommy!
segments.cn: 哇，妈妈！

segments.en: Can I get that for my birthday?
segments.cn: 我可以在我的生日时得到这个吗？

segments.en: Wolverine, Jean Grey, Rogue, and Professor X.
segments.cn: 金刚狼，琴·格蕾，罗格和X教授。

segments.en: Collect all four of these special edition collectible X-Men action figures and decide the future of the mutants in our world.
segments.cn: 收集这四个特别版的X战警动作玩偶，决定变种人在我们世界的未来。

segments.en: No way!
segments.cn: 不可能！

segments.en: I want Professor X!
segments.cn: 我想要X教授！

segments.en: The new Collector's Edition Nursery Rhymes Porcelain Dolls.
segments.cn: 新的收藏版童谣瓷娃娃。

segments.en: Little Bo Peep comes with her own sheep and staff.
segments.cn: 小波皮普带着她自己的羊和牧羊杖。

segments.en: Her clothes are made with the finest fabrics and real Italian lace.
segments.cn: 她的衣服用最好的面料和真正的意大利蕾丝制成。

segments.en: Her face has been hand painted by our finest artists.
segments.cn: 她的脸是由我们最优秀的艺术家手工绘制的。

segments.en: Only $199.
segments.cn: 仅售199美元。

segments.en: Oh, she's pretty!
segments.cn: 哦，她真漂亮！

segments.en: I've never had a porcelain doll before.
segments.cn: 我从来没有拥有过瓷娃娃。

segments.en: I doubt Mom and Dad will get you that for your birthday.
segments.cn: 我怀疑爸爸妈妈会在你的生日时给你买这个。

segments.en: She costs a pretty penny.
segments.cn: 她的价格不菲。

segments.en: Plus, you'd most likely break her.
segments.cn: 而且，你很可能会把她弄坏。

segments.en: What is better than a board?
segments.cn: 什么比一个棋盘更好？

segments.en: What is better than one board game?
segments.cn: 什么比一个棋盘游戏更好？

segments.en: Three board games in one!
segments.cn: 三个棋盘游戏合为一！

segments.en: Enjoy playing chess and checkers on this side of the board.
segments.cn: 享受在棋盘这一侧玩国际象棋和跳棋。

segments.en: But if you're looking for some more fun, flip it and play the classic game of Sorry!
segments.cn: 但如果你想要更多的乐趣，翻转它，玩经典游戏“对不起！”

segments.en: That's ingenious!
segments.cn: 这真是巧妙！

segments.en: Why hasn't anyone thought of that before?
segments.cn: 为什么之前没有人想到这个？

segments.en: Now you can take SpongeBob SquarePants wherever you go with the new SpongeBob SquarePants glow in the dark yo-yo.
segments.cn: 现在你可以带着新的海绵宝宝夜光悠悠球随时随地。

segments.en: And now, back to our show.
segments.cn: 现在，回到我们的节目。

segments.en: Okay, so the first phrase here in Fluency Builder is a really important one for anyone who's buying anything because you often see this phrase on packages or you hear it in commercials.
segments.cn: 好的，所以流利构建者中的第一个短语对任何购买东西的人来说都非常重要，因为你经常在包装上看到这个短语，或者在广告中听到。

segments.en: Right, as you saw in the Play-Doh commercial, the guy said, treasure chest sold separately.
segments.cn: 对，就像你在Play-Doh广告中看到的，那个家伙说，宝箱单独出售。

segments.en: Okay, sold separately.
segments.cn: 好的，单独出售。

segments.en: That means the treasure chest is not included.
segments.cn: 这意味着宝箱不包括在内。

segments.en: You have to buy it extra.
segments.cn: 你必须额外购买。

segments.en: As you say, you usually see it in packaging as well.
segments.cn: 正如你所说，你通常也会在包装上看到它。

segments.en: Maybe you buy a toy car.
segments.cn: 也许你买了一辆玩具车。

segments.en: And at the bottom, it will say, batteries sold separately.
segments.cn: 在底部，它会写着，电池单独出售。

segments.en: That means there are no batteries in the box.
segments.cn: 这意味着盒子里没有电池。

segments.en: You have to buy batteries extra.
segments.cn: 你必须额外购买电池。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So that's what the phrase, sold separately, means.
segments.cn: 所以这就是“单独出售”这个短语的意思。

segments.en: It indicates that it's not included in the product that you are buying.
segments.cn: 它表示不包括在你购买的产品中。

segments.en: All right, now moving on again to the action figures and the dolls.
segments.cn: 好的，现在再次继续谈论动作玩偶和娃娃。

segments.en: We saw this very interesting way of describing them.
segments.cn: 我们看到了一种非常有趣的描述方式。

segments.en: For example, the action figure said, special edition collectible X-Men action figures.
segments.cn: 例如，动作玩偶说，特别版收藏X战警动作玩偶。

segments.en: Okay, special edition.
segments.cn: 好的，特别版。

segments.en: This is really important.
segments.cn: 这真的很重要。

segments.en: And it's very common, I think, with special toys or action figures or even baseball cards.
segments.cn: 我认为这在特别玩具、动作玩偶甚至棒球卡中都很常见。

segments.en: Special edition means that they're produced specially on one occasion, at one time.
segments.cn: 特别版意味着它们是在某个特定场合、某个时间特别生产的。

segments.en: They're not always produced.
segments.cn: 它们并不是总是生产的。

segments.en: So for example, if you have, like you say, baseball cards or maybe action figures, they're produced normally, but then a limited amount, a special type of the same action figure will be produced.
segments.cn: 所以例如，如果你有棒球卡或动作玩偶，它们通常是正常生产的，但会生产有限数量的同款特别版动作玩偶。

segments.en: So that's a special edition or also commonly known as a collector's edition.
segments.cn: 所以这就是特别版，通常也被称为收藏版。

segments.en: All right, so some people collect stamps, you know, stamps for letters that you send.
segments.cn: 好吧，有些人收集邮票，你知道的，就是你寄信用的邮票。

segments.en: And I know many countries, like America, offer special edition or collector's edition stamps.
segments.cn: 我知道很多国家，比如美国，提供特别版或收藏版邮票。

segments.en: These are produced once and usually they Mark a special occasion.
segments.cn: 这些邮票通常只生产一次，通常标志着一个特殊的场合。

segments.en: Like the Olympics in 1996, we had special edition stamps.
segments.cn: 比如1996年的奥运会，我们有特别版邮票。

segments.en: Right, so these special edition objects are usually not used.
segments.cn: 对，所以这些特别版物品通常不被使用。

segments.en: They're for collectors, like the name says, right, collector's edition.
segments.cn: 它们是给收藏家的，正如名字所说，收藏版。

segments.en: Right, so you plan to sell them later on, or you collect them for yourself.
segments.cn: 对，所以你计划以后出售它们，或者为自己收藏。

segments.en: They're not normal.
segments.cn: 它们不是普通的。

segments.en: Right, they usually go up in value because they're very limited.
segments.cn: 对，它们通常会增值，因为数量非常有限。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, so collector's edition, special edition.
segments.cn: 好的，所以收藏版，特别版。

segments.en: And now when they were talking about the porcelain dolls, as well, it's pretty expensive, right?
segments.cn: 现在当他们谈论瓷娃娃时，这个也很贵，对吧？

segments.en: Almost $200.
segments.cn: 几乎200美元。

segments.en: That's a really expensive doll.
segments.cn: 这真的是个很贵的娃娃。

segments.en: And so one of the kids said, you know what?
segments.cn: 所以有一个孩子说，你知道吗？

segments.en: I think mom and dad won't buy you that because it costs a pretty penny.
segments.cn: 我觉得爸爸妈妈不会给你买这个，因为它太贵了。

segments.en: A pretty penny.
segments.cn: 太贵了。

segments.en: This does not mean that the penny is beautiful.
segments.cn: 这并不意味着一分钱是美丽的。

segments.en: Right, a penny is a one cent coin in the United States.
segments.cn: 对，一分钱是美国的一种一美分硬币。

segments.en: That means it's very, very low in value, the coin.
segments.cn: 这意味着它的价值非常低。

segments.en: But a pretty penny is actually the opposite.
segments.cn: 但“太贵了”实际上是相反的意思。

segments.en: It means it's very expensive.
segments.cn: 它意味着非常昂贵。

segments.en: So why would, how would you use this in another, in another example?
segments.cn: 那么你会如何在另一个例子中使用这个呢？

segments.en: I've always wanted to buy a Ferrari, but man, Ferraris cost a pretty penny.
segments.cn: 我一直想买一辆法拉利，但法拉利真的很贵。

segments.en: Okay, so you have to add the word cost before you say pretty penny, right?
segments.cn: 好的，所以你必须在说“太贵了”之前加上“成本”这个词，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: You can't say it is a pretty penny.
segments.cn: 你不能说“这是太贵了”。

segments.en: You have to say it costs a pretty penny.
segments.cn: 你必须说“它的成本很高”。

segments.en: Or it's worth a pretty penny.
segments.cn: 或者“它值很多钱”。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: It's worth a pretty penny.
segments.cn: 它值很多钱。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And for our last phrase, I think this one is a very good phrase because it describes a lot of different toys that glow in the dark, glow in the dark toys.
segments.cn: 对于我们的最后一句话，我认为这句话非常好，因为它描述了许多不同的夜光玩具。

segments.en: Okay, so something that glows in the dark, the verb here is to glow, means that it can be seen even when it's dark.
segments.cn: 好的，夜光的东西，动词是“发光”，意味着即使在黑暗中也能被看到。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So for example, when I turn the lights off and I can see this yo-yo in my room, that means it's glow in the dark.
segments.cn: 例如，当我关灯时，我可以在我的房间里看到这个悠悠球，这意味着它是夜光的。

segments.en: It has light even in the dark.
segments.cn: 它在黑暗中也有光。

segments.en: Right, so there are a lot of different toys and things like this.
segments.cn: 对，所以有很多不同的玩具和这样的东西。

segments.en: Usually glow in the dark toys, they have a green glow, right?
segments.cn: 通常夜光玩具，它们在黑暗中呈绿色光芒，对吧？

segments.en: They look green in the dark.
segments.cn: 它们在黑暗中看起来是绿色的。

segments.en: I used to have stars.
segments.cn: 我以前有星星。

segments.en: So they were stickers, star stickers, and I put them on my ceiling so that when I was in bed, I could look at them and they were glow in the dark.
segments.cn: 所以它们是贴纸，星星贴纸，我把它们贴在天花板上，这样当我在床上时，我可以看着它们，它们是夜光的。

segments.en: So when the lights were off, I still had stars.
segments.cn: 所以当灯关掉时，我仍然有星星。

segments.en: You can still see them, right?
segments.cn: 你仍然可以看到它们，对吧？

segments.en: So yeah, glow in the dark.
segments.cn: 所以是的，夜光。

segments.en: It's a way of describing an item, an object that you are able to see in the dark.
segments.cn: 这是描述一个物品、一个你能在黑暗中看到的物体的方式。

segments.en: All right, so that's all we have for you on language.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们关于语言的全部内容。

segments.en: All right, so that's all we have for you on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们关于流利度提升的全部内容。

segments.en: Why don't we go back, listen to the dialogue one last time, and we'll be back to talk some more.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回去，再听一次对话，然后我们会回来再聊聊。

segments.en: SpongeBob SquarePants will be right back after these brave messages.
segments.cn: 海绵宝宝将在这些勇敢的广告之后回来。

segments.en: What's that on the horizon?
segments.cn: 地平线上是什么？

segments.en: A pirate ship!
segments.cn: 一艘海盗船！

segments.en: Raid villages and find buried treasure with this new pirate's Lego set.
segments.cn: 用这个新的海盗乐高套装袭击村庄并寻找埋藏的宝藏。

segments.en: Build the ship and decide who rules the sea.
segments.cn: 建造船只，决定谁统治海洋。

segments.en: Cool!
segments.cn: 酷！

segments.en: The new Play-Doh Sparkling Brite's precious gem press.
segments.cn: 新的Play-Doh Sparkling Brite的珍贵宝石压模。

segments.en: Make large colorful gems for you and your friends with five special molds.
segments.cn: 用五个特殊模具为你和你的朋友制作大型彩色宝石。

segments.en: Comes with the new Sparkling Brite's Play-Doh compound in four new colors.
segments.cn: 附带四种新颜色的Sparkling Brite Play-Doh。

segments.en: Treasure chest sold separately.
segments.cn: 宝箱单独出售。

segments.en: Wow, Mommy!
segments.cn: 哇，妈妈！

segments.en: Can I get that for my birthday?
segments.cn: 我可以在我的生日得到这个吗？

segments.en: Wolverine, Jean Grey, Rogue, and Professor X.
segments.cn: 金刚狼、琴·格蕾、罗格和X教授。

segments.en: Collect all four of these special edition collectible X-Men action figures and decide the future of the mutants in our world.
segments.cn: 收集这四个特别版收藏的X战警动作玩偶，决定我们世界中变种人的未来。

segments.en: No way!
segments.cn: 不可能！

segments.en: I want Professor X!
segments.cn: 我想要X教授！

segments.en: The new collector's edition nursery rhymes porcelain dolls.
segments.cn: 新的收藏版童谣瓷娃娃。

segments.en: Little Bo Peep comes with her own shape and staff.
segments.cn: 小波皮带着她自己的形状和权杖。

segments.en: Her clothes are made with the finest fabrics and real Italian lace.
segments.cn: 她的衣服用最好的面料和真正的意大利蕾丝制成。

segments.en: And her face has been hand painted by our finest artists.
segments.cn: 她的脸是由我们最优秀的艺术家手工绘制的。

segments.en: Only $199.
segments.cn: 仅售199美元。

segments.en: Ooh, she's pretty!
segments.cn: 哦，她真漂亮！

segments.en: I've never had a porcelain doll before.
segments.cn: 我从来没有拥有过瓷娃娃。

segments.en: I doubt Mom and Dad will get you that for your birthday.
segments.cn: 我怀疑爸爸妈妈会在你的生日给你买这个。

segments.en: She costs a pretty penny.
segments.cn: 她的价格很高。

segments.en: Plus, you'd most likely break her.
segments.cn: 而且，你很可能会把她弄坏。

segments.en: What is better than a board?
segments.cn: 什么比一个棋盘更好？

segments.en: What is better than one board game?
segments.cn: 什么比一个棋盘游戏更好？

segments.en: Three board games in one!
segments.cn: 三个棋盘游戏合为一体！

segments.en: Enjoy playing chess and checkers on this side of the board.
segments.cn: 在棋盘的一侧享受下棋和跳棋。

segments.en: But if you're looking for some more fun, flip it and play the classic game of Sorry.
segments.cn: 但如果你想要更多的乐趣，翻转它，玩经典的“对不起”游戏。

segments.en: That's ingenious!
segments.cn: 这真是太聪明了！

segments.en: Why hasn't anyone thought of that before?
segments.cn: 为什么之前没有人想到这个？

segments.en: Now you can take SpongeBob SquarePants wherever you go with the new SpongeBob SquarePants glow in the dark yo-yo.
segments.cn: 现在你可以带着新的海绵宝宝夜光悠悠球随时随地。

segments.en: And now, back to our show.
segments.cn: 现在，回到我们的节目。

segments.en: All right, so talking about toys, these are really interesting toys.
segments.cn: 好的，谈到玩具，这些玩具真的很有趣。

segments.en: Are there any specific toys that you had when you were growing up or that you really, really liked?
segments.cn: 你小时候有没有特别的玩具，或者你特别喜欢的玩具？

segments.en: I had an amazing Brio train set.
segments.cn: 我有一个很棒的Brio火车套装。

segments.en: Okay, this is when I was young.
segments.cn: 好的，这是我年轻时的事情。

segments.en: And a train set is basically like Legos with trains.
segments.cn: 火车套装基本上就像是带火车的乐高。

segments.en: So you build a track and you push the train around the track.
segments.cn: 所以你搭建轨道，把火车推着在轨道上走。

segments.en: And so I used to have a track that was as big as the living room.
segments.cn: 所以我以前有一个轨道，和客厅一样大。

segments.en: And my challenge, my goal was to use every single piece.
segments.cn: 我的挑战，我的目标是使用每一块。

segments.en: Which is very hard because some pieces don't fit with other pieces.
segments.cn: 这很难，因为有些部件与其他部件不匹配。

segments.en: And so that was my favorite toy because I got to be very creative.
segments.cn: 所以那是我最喜欢的玩具，因为我可以非常有创意。

segments.en: And then you would turn on the train and it would go away.
segments.cn: 然后你打开火车，它就会走。

segments.en: It wasn't electric, so I had to push it myself.
segments.cn: 它不是电动的，所以我得自己推。

segments.en: What was your favorite toy?
segments.cn: 你最喜欢的玩具是什么？

segments.en: Actually, when I was growing up, I used to collect little toy cars.
segments.cn: 其实，当我长大的时候，我喜欢收集小玩具车。

segments.en: I had a lot of toys.
segments.cn: 我有很多玩具。

segments.en: I used to have a lot of little toy cars.
segments.cn: 我以前有很多小玩具车。

segments.en: And I even had a little special box for them so I could see them.
segments.cn: 我甚至有一个小特制盒子来放它们，这样我就可以看到它们。

segments.en: And then as time went on, I got to collect the scale cars.
segments.cn: 然后随着时间的推移，我开始收集比例模型车。

segments.en: You know, the ones that are 1 to 10, 1 to 4.
segments.cn: 你知道的，1比10，1比4的那种。

segments.en: Did you build them or did you buy them made?
segments.cn: 你是自己组装的还是买现成的？

segments.en: No, usually I bought them made.
segments.cn: 不，通常我买现成的。

segments.en: I actually tried the whole building model cars, model airplanes, but it's so hard.
segments.cn: 我其实尝试过自己组装模型车、模型飞机，但太难了。

segments.en: Very hard.
segments.cn: 非常难。

segments.en: Even adults have a hard time with that.
segments.cn: 连成年人都觉得很难。

segments.en: It's very difficult.
segments.cn: 这非常困难。

segments.en: So I don't know what type of kid actually does that when they're growing up.
segments.cn: 所以我不知道什么样的孩子在成长过程中会这样做。

segments.en: But yeah, so many toys out there.
segments.cn: 但确实，外面有很多玩具。

segments.en: So many people collect them, play with them.
segments.cn: 很多人收集它们，玩它们。

segments.en: You have childhood toys that you're very fond of.
segments.cn: 你有很喜欢的童年玩具。

segments.en: So that's what we want to know.
segments.cn: 所以这就是我们想知道的。

segments.en: What type of toy did you grow up with?
segments.cn: 你小时候喜欢什么类型的玩具？

segments.en: What did you like to play with when you were a kid?
segments.cn: 你小时候喜欢玩什么？

segments.en: Or if you have kids, what toys do your kids like?
segments.cn: 或者如果你有孩子，你的孩子喜欢什么玩具？

segments.en: Because we're not too familiar with toys these days.
segments.cn: 因为我们对现在的玩具不太熟悉。

segments.en: We'd be curious to hear about those.
segments.cn: 我们很想听听这些。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So we want to hear from you.
segments.cn: 所以我们想听听你的意见。

segments.en: Come to EnglishPod.com and we'll see everyone there.
segments.cn: 来到EnglishPod.com，我们会在那里见到大家。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
